column15: Inventors

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR REMOVING PARTICULATE SOLIDS FROM A FLUID STREAM
column13: Apparatus for removing particulate solids from a bulk flow of liquid comprises a substantially straight channel (1) for receiving the flow and provided with means for controlling the flow such that solid particles above a predetermined size will tend to settle to the bed of the channel (1) and be transported along the channel bed by shear force exerted by the bulk flow. At least one solid particle removal port (3) is provided at the bed of the channel extending across substantially the full width of the channel bed. In operation solid particles are delivered to the port (3) by said shear force.
column15: CHILTON RICHARD;;RAINS JONATHAN

column12: Method and apparatus for removing particulate solids from a fluid stream
column15: CHILTON RICHARD;;RAINS JONATHAN

column12: Data storage system with improved network interface
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A
column32: Geoffray P, "OPIOM: Off-Processor I/O with Myrinet", Future Generation Computer Systems, v18, n4, pp 491-499, Mar 2002, ISSN 0167-739X.

column12: Data storage system with improved network interface
column13: A data storage system has a backplane, processing circuitry and a NIC. The processing circuitry is physically connected to the backplane, and can perform block-based data access operations. The NIC has a first port that that couples to an external network, a second port that physically connects to the backplane, and control circuitry interconnected between the first port and the second port. The control circuitry can (i) receive file-based communications from the external network through the first port and provide block-based communications to the processing circuitry through the second port and the backplane in response to the file-based communications, (ii) receive block-based communications from the processing circuitry through the second port and the backplane and provide file-based communications to the external network through the first port in response to the block-based communications, and (iii) provide application server resources to operate as an application server that runs application-level programs.
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A
column16: EMC CORPORATION (2001-05-09);;EMC IP HOLDING COMPANY LLC (2016-09-06)
column32: British Search Report from Application No. GB 0210551.8, filed Nov. 21, 2002, 1 Page.;;Geoffray P; "OPIOM: Off-Processor I/O with Myrinet", Future Generation Computer Systems, v 18, n4, pp. 491-499, Mar. 2002, ISSN 0167-739X.

column12: Data storage system with one or more integrated server-like behaviors
column13: A network adapter is provided that may be used in a network data storage system to facilitate data communication among external data exchanging devices and an input/output (I/O) controller residing in the system. The adapter includes one or more interfaces that may be coupled to an electrical backplane in the system. The backplane is coupled to the controller, and is configured to permit communication between the controller and the adapter when the interfaces are coupled to the backplane. The adapter may provide one or more file server-like behaviors.
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A
column16: EMC CORPORATION (2001-09-10);;EMC IP HOLDING COMPANY LLC (2016-09-06)
column32: Geoffray P; "OPIOM: Off-Processor I/O with Myrinet", Future Generation Computer Systems, v 18, n4, pp. 491-499, Mar. 2002, ISSN 0167-739X.;;British Search Report from Application No. GB 0210551.8, filed Nov. 21, 2002, 1 Page.

column13: Es wird ein Datenspeichersystem vorgeschlagen, das eine Hintergrundebene, Verarbeitungsschaltungseinrichtungen und eine Netzwerk-Schnittstelleneinrichtung aufweist. Die Verarbeitungsschaltungseinrichtung kann Datenzugriffsoperationen auf Blockbasis durchführen. Die Netzwerk-Schnittstelleneinrichtung hat eine erste Schnittstelle, welche die Kopplung zu einem externen Netzwerk vornimmt, eine zweite Schnittstelle, welche körperlich mit der Hintergrundebene verbunden ist, sowie eine Steuerungsschaltungseinrichtung, die zwischen die erste Schnittstelle und die zweite Schnittstelle geschaltet ist. Die Steuerungsschaltungseinrichtung kann DOLLAR A (i) Kommunikationen auf Dateibasis von dem externen Netzwerk über die erste Schnittstelle empfangen und Kommunikationen auf Blockbasis an die Verarbeitungsschaltungseinrichtung über die zweite Schnittstelle und die Hintergrundebene in Abhängigkeit von den Kommunikationen auf Dateibasis liefern, DOLLAR A (ii) Kommunikationen auf Blockbasis von der Verarbeitungsschaltungseinrichtung über die zweite Schnittstelle und die Hintergrundebene empfangen und Kommunikationen auf Dateibasis über die erste Schnittstelle in Abhängigkeit von den Kommunikationen auf Blockbasis an das externe Netzwerk liefern. Schließlich kann die Steuerungsschaltungseinrichtung Applikationsservermöglichkeiten bieten, um als ein Applikationsserver zu arbeiten, der Programme auf Verwenderniveau laufen läßt.
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A

column12: Data storage system with network interface operable as application server
column13: A data storage system 50 has a backplane, processing circuitry 56-60 and a network interface device 54. The processing circuitry can perform block-based data access operations. The network interface device has a first interface that couples to an external network, a second interface that physically connects to the backplane, and control circuitry 72 interconnected between the first interface and the second interface. The control circuitry can (i) receive file-based communications from the external network 26 through the first interface and provide block-based communications to the processing circuitry through the second interface and the backplane in response to the file-based communications, (ii) receive block-based communications from the processing circuitry through the second interface and the backplane and provide file-based communications to the external network through the first interface in response to the block-based communications, and (iii) provide application server resources to operate as an application server that runs application-level programs.
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A

The backplane is coupled to the controller, and is configured to permit communication between the controller and the adapter when the interfaces are coupled to the backplane. column12: DATA STORAGE SYSTEM HAVING IMPROVED NETWORK INTERFACE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a data storage system having an improved network interface dispensing with an external front end server. SOLUTION: This data storage system is provided with a back plane, a processing circuit, and a network interface device. The processing circuit executes data access operation on a block base. The network interface device is provided with a first interface, a second interface and a control circuit mutually connected between the first interface and the second interface. The control circuit can (i) receive the communication on a file base and provide the communication on the block base to the processing circuit, (ii) receive the communication on the block base from the processing circuit and provide the communication on the file base, (iii) and provide the application server resource.
column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A

column12: DATA STORAGE SYSTEM WITH IMPROVED NETWORK INTERFACE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a data storage system with an improved network interface without requiring any external front end server.

SOLUTION: A data storage system has a backplane, processing circuitry and a network interface device (NIC). The processing circuitry performs block-based data access operations. The NIC has a first interface, a second interface and control circuitry interconnected between the first interface and the second interface. The control circuitry can (i) receive file-based communications and provide block-based communications to the processing circuitry, (ii) receive block-based communications from the processing circuitry and provide file-based communications, and (iii) provide application server resources.

column15: BARROW JONATHAN J;;CHILTON KENDELL A

column12: Remotely controlled, transformable, water squirting toy vehicles
column13: A remotely controllable, transforming, water squirting toy vehicle includes a structure in the form of a lever arm mounted for pivotal movement with respect to a remainder of the vehicle from a first position in which a surface of the arm is hidden within the vehicle to a second, elevated position in which the hidden surface of the arm is exposed. The hidden surface of the arm bears the likeness of a snake or other creature and includes a nozzle fluidly coupled to a pump and reservoir within the remainder of the vehicle. A control system in the vehicle receives and processes steering and propulsion control signals as well as an arm raising/water pumping control signal. A single actuator controls the movement of the lever arm which is spring loaded, by releasing the lever arm from a latched position and powers the pump driving liquid from the reservoir to the nozzle.
column15: CHILTON SETH M;;HETMAN MICHAEL G;;JAFFE JONATHAN A

column12: Bottom outlet valve removable independent steam jacket
column13: A removable independent steam jacket for a bottom outlet valve of a railroad tank car able to connect to an existing bottom outlet valve, with or without an integral steam jacket, in a field environment without having to take the tank car in for repairs having a partially annular hollow base with a rectangular cross-section and a plurality of pipes connected to the base extending away from the bottom of the base. The removable steam jacket also has a plurality of mounting brackets connected to the bottom the base for installing and removing it from the bottom outlet valve.

column13: The present invention relates to a transbuccal plate holding cannula used in osteofixation procedures. The transbuccal plate holding cannula of the present invention can be releasibly secured to a bone plate such that tools and fasteners may be passed through the plate holding cannula in order to secure the bone plate to a bone.

column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an instrument that securely holds a plate and allows the passage of tools and fasteners, such as drills and screws, through the instrument to secure the plate to a bone, and to provide a bone plate.SOLUTION: The invention relates to a cannula holding a transbuccal plate used in osteofixation procedures, and the bone plate. The cannula holding the transbuccal plate can be releasably secured to the bone plate such that the tools and fasteners can be passed through the cannula holding the plate in order to secure the bone plate to the bone. The invention also provides the bone plate including a front surface, a back surface, at least one hole extending from the front surface to the back surface through the plate in order to receive the fastener of the bone, and recesses on the back surface formed on the periphery of the plate close to the holes and having a surface substantially parallel to the front surface.

column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an instrument which securely holds a plate and allows the passage of tools and fasteners, such as drills and screws, through the instrument to fix the plate to a bone, and to provide a bone plate.SOLUTION: A cannula holding a transbuccal plate can be fixed to the bone plate so as to be loosened such that the tools and fasteners can be passed through the cannula which is holding the plate in order to fix the bone plate to the bone. The invention also provides the bone plate including a front surface, a back surface, a peripheral edge, at least one hole extending from the front surface to the back surface through the bone plate in order to receive the fastener of the bone, and at least two recesses which are formed on the back surface, are close to the periphery of the holes, are disposed in parallel with the holes in the axial direction, and extend axially outwardly from the holes.
